Puchner
14 .IV. 2006
( 1 ex., CRS); Kenya , central south, Kibwezi Forest, Spring Camp 28 .– 29.11 ., 2004 leg. Puchner ( 1 ex., CRS).
Head: Red-brown to almost black; finely and diffusely punctate to wrinkled.

Antennae: Red-brown to dark brown; not reaching base of pronotum when laid alongside; A 5 –A 10 serrate. Pronotum: Light to dark reddish brown (disc may be black with reddish brown spots); anterior half subparallel, conspicuously constricted towards base; surface anterior to transverse depression wrinkled; disc finely and diffusely punctate and wrinkled, with four more or less distint elevations; length:width ratio 1.49 : 1 . Scutellum: Brown to red.

Elytra: Light brown to red-brown, each elytron with a whitish to yellow lateral spot in the basal third and a whitish to yellow transverse fascia in the middle, mostly spanning from lateral to sutural margins, with a narrow, short extension towards base, fascia more or less broadly bordered black; diameter of punctures smaller, equal or larger than interstices, behind fasciae elongate, apex finely punctate; length:width ratio 2.46 : 1 .
Lower surface: Head and prothorax brown to red, meso- and metathorax dark brown to black-brown, abdomen light brown to red-brown with first ventrite darker.
Vestiture: With whitish to yellowish hairs.
Distribution: Cameroon , Kenya , Nigeria , Rwanda , South Africa , Tanzania , Zimbabwe .
